      int getXMax()
      Returns maximum x (rightmost) value a bounded actor can have in the container.
      int getXMin()
      Returns the minimum x (leftmost) value that a bounded actor should be able to have in the container.
      int getYMax()
      Returns maximum y (bottommost) value a bounded actor can have in the container
      int getYMin()
      Returns minimum y (topmost) value a bounded actor can have in the container.

      void setBoundsDimension(java.awt.Dimension boundsDimension) 
      void setCenterOfViewActor(CenterOfViewActor centerOfViewActor) 
      void stepActor(Actor a)
      This is a helper function for stepAllActors, which calls this method on every Actor in the ContainerUniverse with the exception of the Background, Wall Actors, HUD elements and the CenterOfView Actor.
      void stepAllActors()
      This method makes all actors, including the camera/CenterOfView actor take a step forward with their current velocity; All actors except for the camera/CenterOfView actor should "bounce" off of walls upon colliding.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • actorIsValidInContainerUniverse

      • stepAllActors

        public void stepAllActors()
        This method makes all actors, including the camera/CenterOfView actor take a step forward with their current velocity; All actors except for the camera/CenterOfView actor should "bounce" off of walls upon colliding.

      • stepActor

        public void stepActor(Actor a)
        This is a helper function for stepAllActors, which calls this method on every Actor in the ContainerUniverse with the exception of the Background, Wall Actors, HUD elements and the CenterOfView Actor.
        Parameters:
        a - - actor to step
